snippet: Of all the major industrialized countries, only Germany and Japan have managed to return to their 2007 employment levels.
abstract: Floyd Norris Off the Charts column says most industrialized countries, with notable exceptions of Germany and Japan, have smaller proportion of their working-age population employed than they did at end of 2007, before Great Recession began.
lead_paragraph: Of all the major industrialized countries, only Germany and Japan have managed to return to their 2007 employment levels.

headline.print_headline: Most G-7 Nations Still Trying to Recoup Lost Jobs
headline.main: Most G-7 Nations Still Trying to Recoup Lost Jobs
